title: 1714-C
statement: C. Minimum Varied Numbertime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputFind the minimum number with the given sum of digits $$$s$$$ such thatalldigits in it are distinct (i.e. all digits are unique).For example, if $$$s=20$$$, then the answer is $$$389$$$. This is the minimum number in which all digits are different and the sum of the digits is $$$20$$$ ($$$3+8+9=20$$$).For the given $$$s$$$ print the required number.InputThe first line contains an integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \\le t \\le 45$$$) — the number of test cases.Each test case is specified by a line that contains the only integer $$$s$$$ ($$$1 \\le s \\le 45$$$).OutputPrint $$$t$$$ integers — the answers to the given test cases.ExampleInput42084510Output389 8 123456789 19

processed.result:
You are given a number $s$. Find the smallest number that has all unique digits and adds up to $s$.

For example, if $s = 20$, the answer is 389 because 3, 8, and 9 are all different digits and their sum is 20.

Input:

The first line contains the number of test cases, $t$.

Each test case is a line with a number $s$.

Output:

Print $t$ numbers, one for each test case, representing the smallest number with unique digits that sums to $s$.
Given a number, find the smallest number with all unique digits that adds up to that number.
